arguments.text: Tech Giant announced today it will acquire AI Startup for $2.3 billion, aiming to integrate advanced machine‑learning capabilities into its cloud platform. The deal, expected to close by Q2 2026, positions the company at the forefront of generative AI services. Analysts predict a potential 5‑7% boost to the acquirer's share price following the announcement.

The S&P 500 rose to a new all‑time high of 5,150 points on Monday, driven by strong earnings reports from several tech and consumer‑discretionary firms. Market optimism is bolstered by easing inflation concerns and stable monetary policy outlook. Experts caution that the rally may face volatility if upcoming corporate earnings miss expectations.

Global supply‑chain disruptions have begun to ease, according to the latest data from the International Trade Organization. Shipping times have shortened by 12% over the past month, and inventory levels are stabilizing. The improvement is attributed to the resolution of port bottlenecks and a modest rebound in manufacturing output across Asia.
